spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall zoning roughly matches (Living/Dining left, Kitchen+Utility top, Bedroom right, Toilet near center-right), but several layout details diverge. The small shaft/duct shown to the right of Toilet-1 in the 2D plan is not represented as an open shaft and appears enclosed/usable in 3D (E5/E2). Door locations are not faithfully reproduced: the bathroom and bedroom access points appear shifted relative to the plan’s short passage alignment (E2), and the balcony opening/threshold does not clearly match the plan’s balcony edge/entry position (E2). Proportions are off: Toilet/wardrobe zone and the central passage read wider in 3D than in plan; living area depth vs bedroom width appears distorted (E4). Window placement is inconsistent: the 3D shows large continuous glazing on the bedroom exterior and additional window placements that do not clearly correspond to the plan’s specific openings (E2).

structural_fidelity.notes: Key adjacency relationships mostly hold (Kitchen adjacent Living; Utility adjacent Kitchen; Toilet near Bedroom), but the right-side duct/shaft is structurally misrepresented as enclosed space (E5). Door embedding/orientation is inconsistent with the 2D swing placements, especially around the toilet/bedroom junction (E2/E3). Wall thickness looks somewhat uniform, but several partitions appear re-positioned or thickened, changing the corridor/room boundaries (E4). No major primary room is fully missing, but the plan’s non-occupiable duct element is not correctly modeled (E2/E5).

furniture_mapping.notes: Major furniture types are present (sofa, dining table, bed), but placements do not tightly match the 2D arrangement (e.g., sofa/TV/coffee table grouping and dining position appear shifted) (E2). Scale is generally plausible, though some pieces read undersized relative to circulation widths created in the 3D (E4).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Camera isometric view is acceptable, but the render is low-clarity/blurred with flat lighting. Materials/textures and edges lack definition, and some openings (doors/windows) are hard to read, reducing verifiability (E6). Geometry is mostly clean, though proportion distortions in partitions reduce architectural credibility.

detected_errors.description: The duct/shaft shown to the right of Toilet-1 in the 2D plan appears modeled as an enclosed/usable space in the 3D render rather than a service shaft.
Toilet/bedroom/passage partition lines appear shifted, changing the exact room boundary alignment compared with the 2D plan.
Bathroom door position and/or connection to the passage does not match the 2D plan’s door location.
Balcony opening/threshold placement and the balcony edge relationship to the living area do not clearly match the 2D plan.
Window placements (notably the large bedroom glazing and additional openings) do not clearly correspond to the specific window locations in the 2D plan.
Room proportions are distorted: the toilet/wardrobe/passage zone reads wider in 3D than in the 2D plan, affecting circulation and relative room sizes.
Rendering blur/low detail makes doors, windows, and exact wall junctions difficult to verify, reducing clarity.
